alert.note: Alert for Clay; Laurel; McCreary; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 1:08PM EDT until July 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel, McCreary, Wayne and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 107 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Barbourville, Whitley City, Youngs Creek, Clio, Deering, Walden, Krupp, Bark Camp, Goldbug, Grove, Redbird, Rye, Faber, Cumberland Falls S.P., Rockholds, Wofford, Bounty, Barton and Duckrun.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
